title: Encyclopedia of education and human development, Volume one-three
subject: Education$$QEducation -- Encyclopedias
Educational psychology$$QEducational psychology -- Encyclopedias
Psychopédagogie$$QPsychopédagogie -- Encyclopédies
EDUCATION -- Essays
EDUCATION -- Organizations & Institutions
EDUCATION -- Reference
Education
Educational psychology
description: This comprehensive and exhaustive reference work on the subject of education from the primary grades through higher education combines educational theory with practice, making it a unique contribution to the educational reference market. Issues related to human development and learning are examined by individuals whose specializations are in diverse areas including education, psychology, sociology, philosophy, law, and medicine. The book focuses on important themes in education and human development. Authors consider each entry from the perspective of its social and political conditions as wel.
contributor: Farenga, Stephen J., 1958- editor.$$QFarenga, Stephen J.
